revised_title: Dielectric Properties and Residual Charge of Leyden Jars
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the residual charge and dielectric properties of Leyden jars made of different glasses. They verified two propositions related to the superposition of electric effects and the relationship between residual and exciting charges. The authors also investigated the conductivity and residual charge in various glasses, suggesting that electrolytic conduction may occur in some types of glass at room temperature. Their findings support the principle of superposition in the phenomenon of conduction through glass.
